applogic

Class PlayingField

  • java.lang.Object
    • applogic.PlayingField

  • public class PlayingField
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for the playing field used as a container for the individual cells that make up the playing field.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayingField(int rows, int columns)
      Sets up the playing field.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewTetrimino()
      Adds a new Tetrimino piece into the playing field and set the next Tetrimino that is going to appear.
      void addNewTetriminoToField(Tetrimino tetrimino)
      Method that adds a new Tetrimino piece to the playing field if it fits in, otherwise the game ends.
      void createCells(int rows, int columns)
      Creates the cells into the playing field.

      Gets the information if the game is over or not.

      Sets the next Tetrimino that is going to appear in the playing field.

        public PlayingField(int rows,
                    int columns)
        Sets up the playing field.
        Parameters:

        columns - how many columns there are to be in the playing field.

        Parameters:
        rows - number of rows that the playing field is going to have.
        columns - number of columns that the playing field is going to have.

        Returns:
        the box which resides at the corresponding coordinates.

        public void moveTetrimino(Direction direction)
        Moves the Tetrimino to the direction specified by a parameter.
        Parameters:
        direction - where the Tetrimino piece is to be moved.

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Gets the information if the game is over or not.
        Returns:
        boolean value true is the game is over, false if not.

      • addNewTetrimino

        public void addNewTetrimino()
        Adds a new Tetrimino piece into the playing field and set the next Tetrimino that is going to appear.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Moves the game cycle(the internal clock of the game) ahead by one unit by moving the tetrimo piece. if the the tetrimino cannot move in that given cycle, the method calls for a new Tetrimino piece and removal of completed rows. Lastly it adds marking to a list that game has gone ahead one cycle.

      • getMapper

        public Mapper getMapper()
        Gets the Mapper object that is associated with playing field.
        Returns:
        Mapper object

      • getDEFAULT_EMPTY_COLOR

        public static java.awt.Color getDEFAULT_EMPTY_COLOR()
        Gets the default empty color.
        Returns:
        Color white.

      • rotateTetriminoClockwise

        public void rotateTetriminoClockwise(Rotation rotation)
        Method that tells the mapper to rotate the Tetrimino piece clockwise.
        Parameters:
        rotation - Clockwise.

      • rotateTetriminoCounterClockwise

        public void rotateTetriminoCounterClockwise(Rotation rotation)
        Method that tells the mapper to rotate the Tetrimino piece counterclockwise.
        Parameters:
        rotation - Counterclockwise.
